title: LGC Carbon AMA
body:
Hello, 

My names Tim "Carbon" Wendel, I'm a long time LoL player having started in season 1. I've been playing competitively in OCE since late 2013 and have been on a number of teams (all with the same people though) in Mindfreak/AvA and ultimately my current team legacy. Last year I represented OCE at Wildcards in Cologne and am currently playing in the second inaugural season of the Oceanic Pro League. I was Diamond 1 in NA before OCE opened and have achieved rank 1 in every season of OCE (bar this one unfortunately, I'm all washed up {{champion:32}} ). 

Outside LoL I graduated university at the beginning of last year (Health Science @ Latrobe) and have worked for a long time part time as a swimming instructor. I turned 23 this year and spend most my time either playing LoL/Smash Bros Melee, working or seeing my friends/girlfriend.  Ask me anything regarding the jungle, competitive  league or soloq! I will also entertain personal questions.


You can follow myself and my team at:

[@OCECarbon](https://twitter.com/OCECarbon)
[Legacy Esports](https://www.facebook.com/LegacyEsportsLoL?ref=hl)
[@LegacyOCE](https://twitter.com/LegacyOCE)

Hi Carbon,
I have a couple of questions.
1. I am in bronze five trying desperately to get out - since tanky jg is the meta should I be playing a tank when I jg, I find that I usually win when I play more carry type champs but then it doesn't always suit the team comp as tanky jg is expected.
2. Do you think an OCE team will make it to Worlds this year?

If you're in Bronze I wouldn't worry too much about team comps and the like. Find a few jungle champions and really try to master the hell out of them. When you're trying to learn something the best thing to do is attempt to remove as many variables as possible. If you are playing the same champ every game you will learn a lot more about the overall game (such as jungle pathing/vision control to name a few) because you will spend less time trying to figure out exactly how to combo your champion.

I'd love for an OCE team to make it to worlds this year, unfortunately we have just gotten SEA put in our group for Wildcards so it just got that little bit more difficult once again.

Why do you feel other OPL teams move their starter roster players to other roles instead of picking up players who main that role?
Looking at teams, Dire Wolves have becomes extremely weak in the top lane by moving a mid player top instead of chasing up top lane mains. Yes they are your teammate and friend, but changing role in a competitive season drastically makes your team worse and it's best to sometimes just man up and kick them.

Legacy have also done this with Tallywacka in the past, which he still seems to not be perfect with his positioning and such (where you could pick up cardrid from your B team or so many decent ADC players in solo q and make your team much stronger) , i'm just curious about the reasoning teams prefer struggle through season with changes like this, when a clear as day option is much more suited.

As a jungler, do you have any tips for coming into the season 5 jungle that people may have overlooked.

Also what do you rate as your personal best jungler, and which jungler do you enjoy most.

I think the best tip for this jungle compared to last seasons jungle is making sure you are using your smite efficiently. Regardless of what smite you have it's super important to make sure you're using it in the right way on the right camps. As for what the right way is, that is an extensive question! My _favourite_ jungler is Poppy, [I was rank 1 Poppy in the world at one point  ](http://puu.sh/fAcTZ/2138374162.jpg). She's extremely fun in soloq but doesnt translate all that well to competitive LoL.

Any chance i can get some tips on the best uses of smite.

I find i really just struggle coming into the new jungle and it's mostly my teamfighting and mechanics that actually bring me to wins over my actual jungle presence or ganking.

Also is there a major difference between jungling in solo queue and jungling in Legacy?

Well, let's just assume you're using purple smite and don't need to use your smite on the enemy, mostly you want to save your smite for the chickens so you can get the oracle buff. However, if you're about to teamfight it's best for you to use your smite on the gromp so you get the thornmail poison thing. If you're invading it's really good to use smite on their wolves so you get the vision buff in their jungle. The golems are basically only good to smite for your original clear or if you're about to siege (the golem buff gives you a small damage increase on your first hit on towers). It gets a bit trickier when you starting playing with red/blue smites. Do you smite the camps for the buffs or do you save it to use on your next gank? Is dragon spawning soon, will there be a teamfight? Do you then use your smite to help you win the teamfight or do you save it so you can secure the dragon after the fight if you don't manage to kill the enemy jungler. There are a lot of variables when it comes to smite now, which makes it interesting.

1. What tips would you give for junglers who have been playing the role for awhile?
2. What sort of jglers would you pick if you wanted early game pressure?
3. Same as above cept for mid-late game pressure.
4. who is your fave pick/go to champ in the jg?
5. How do you build your jg item say as vi and they have a damage jg(warrior or cinder)?
6. good jglers for r5s?

The longer you play jungle the less it becomes about ganking and vision control becomes your main priority. That's my opinion on it at least. If you have been jungling for a while you probably have ganking down pat, try to think more about the way you're pathing yourself and where you're putting  you wards. If you invade his red side jungle and he isn't there, where do you think he probably is? Warn that lane.

Early pressure = Lee Sin, Eve, Reksai, Gragas

Scaling junglers are super risky because jungle is usually only strong for the first 10 minutes of the game and if you opt into making yourself weak during that time you give your opponent a window to snowball. That said Sejuani is a good scaling jungler.

My _favourite_ is poppy. However go-to would be something like Rek'Sai i suppose, she is good in the meta and also has good early pressure with a decent mid game due to her ult. I'm waiting for Elise to come back though, I loved playing her last season.

There are two paths you can take Vi down, I've seen a lot of full DPS Vi's in soloq which can be reasonably successful (warrior into tri/bork) however this doesnt work very well in an organised environment as team fights are more structured. The cinderhulk is much safer and actually does prety decent damage anyway so better to take this option in my opinion.

Good R5's junglers are just whatever is in meta, Sejuani, Gragas, Reksai. That said, I suggest you just play whatever you are good at. Too much emphasis is placed on the meta and I've seen many players put bad perfomances in on meta champs because they feel obliged to play them. You're much better off just playing whatever your main is.

Thanks for the questions! I love talking about the jungle.
